headline: Easy Homemade Doughnuts
description: This easy donut recipe is quick to make using simple pantry staples for delicious soft-on-the-inside, cakey donuts with hardly any wait time!

video.description: Homemade doughnuts dusted with confectioners' sugar.
video.name: Super Easy Doughnuts

name: Easy Homemade Doughnuts

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together milk and vinegar; let stand for a few minutes until thick.

Cream together sugar and shortening in a mixing bowl until smooth. Beat in egg and vanilla until well-blended. Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl; stir into sugar mixture alternating with milk mixture.
Roll dough out on a floured surface to 1/3-inch thickness. Cut into donuts using a donut cutter. Let stand for about 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a large, deep skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Fry donuts in hot oil in batches until golden, turning over once, about 1 to 2 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.
Dust with confectioners' sugar while they are still warm and serve.

review.reviewBody: Donuts turned out great. Soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. I used 3/8 cup milk and not 1/2 the consistency was good for rolling out.
Followed recipe and it was great! Nice and so soft and flaky! Hubby and children were very happy
burned them and they still taste good

So very easy and simple to make. My biggest struggle was converting 3/8 cup not a standard measurement in Australia. But have now calculated it (6 tablespoons) and written on my recipe. These will definitely make an appearance again in my house. Thank you for sharing.
It was a success and it tasted amazing
I really like it and I baked them instead of frayed them lol

This recipe lived up to its name- super easy! No yeast and no buttermilk. Had a craving for donuts around 5:40, my local shop closes at 6. By 7 I had dinner ready and a batch of beautiful donuts waiting to be fried. I read a lot of complaints about this recipe but made no alterations. I found the subtle sweetness of the dough was perfect and it rose better than I was expecting. Only thing I would do differently next time is to add a bit more vanilla, 2 capfuls or so. They will look flat before frying, don’t worry. The dough was sticky sure but not too difficult to work with if you know what you’re doing. The only thing that was a little tough was incorporating the dry ingredients while not over mixing to avoid overworking the dough. Have your sugar ready because they will need to be coated immediately after coming out of the oil for maximum coverage. Best way to serve and eat them is while they are still hot. Fantastic!!! Will make them again.

I made them nice and easy to make for me and my wife and daughter were had a blast my advice was that to us 2 tsp of vanilla extract and a good dash of cinnamon my daughter loved them and so do me and my wife
I will try these maybe using a small cookie scooper instead of rolling them out to make donut holes.
It’s very easy and quick. I use coconut oil instead of shortening which adds a nice flavour. I free pour Mexican vanilla also.

I used lemon instead of vinegar. 
The dough comes out *super* sticky. I just work with that and fry sticky doughnuts. They come out amazing.
Great batter. Taste great.
Excellent! Just adjusted the milk to half a cup under other recommendations posted by other bakers. They are pretty and delicious. I used cookie cutters so mine are bite size and delicious....
These turned out great, tip is to cook at lower temp longer to assure it cooks all the way through
ITS GOOD

I'm not the best at presenting food and the video both encouraged me and heightened my anxiety. (I know - how does that happen?) I've made bread and noodles quite often before, so once my anxiety went away, I figured I'd try. My 3YO daughter and I made these donuts. My family of 5 enjoyed them immensely. I thought, too, it wouldn't make enough, and it actually made extra. We were quite pleased with this easy recipe.

Super easy! Just like it says. Although I used a cast iron skillet and much less oil. Cooked for about 90-120 seconds each side. Watch your oil temp. They came out fantastic. Instead of dusting with confectioners sugar I used white sugar with cinnamon. So delicious!

I added a bit more flour and instead of rolling the dough out, I patted it with floured hands. 
I also sprinkled with cinnamon sugar. Delicious!
Substituted butter for shortening. Used skim milk. Were delicious. Probably would have thickened up better with whole milk but still so easy and fun to make.
I made them for my husband last week. I am making them again tonight. Very good.

Quick and easy. 
My kids love it.

These donuts are really yummy! I did 1/2 a cup of milk like all the reviews said but my dough came out too sticky to roll and cut out. I ended up putting it into this donut press thing that my mom had and just plopped the dough straight into the oil that way, and they turned out great! I'm sure you'd be able to put it into a piping bag and pipe the donut shapes onto some parchment as well. I ended up making some cinnamon sugar to cover them in after and it tasted great
I found that if you use butter instead of shortening they are so much lighter.
Super Easy - Super Tasty. We've been looking for a good donut recipe - nailed it! Added a little cinnamon for spice. We'll be making these again, and again, and ....
i love it it is really good

So yummy!!! Not super fluffy or anything but I easily could of done something wrong. Will definitely make again :) if you’re looking for more of a fluffy, Dunkin’ Donuts style recipe this may not be for you, but they are still so delicious!

These were really sticky and hard to roll out, but after adding a lot of flour (just like I would with pizza dough or gingerbread cookies), it became a lot easier to roll and cut out the doughnuts. They taste delicious, but they also taste exactly like zeppoli. I do love zeppoli, but they don't taste like doughnuts. Still very good and I might make them again sometime soon
Excellent. So delicious
Tasted great when freshly fried but got to mention the dough was very sticky so I followed the advice of wetting my hand which helped. Will make again :)
The doughnuts turned out good. My brother cooked them in an air fryer and they turned out well. He used a glaze on them he found on a different website.
These were easy and delicious!
the doe came out sticky so i added about a half a cup more flour, and also more sugar sult and vanilla for flavoring. it cane out yummy. not fluffy and bouncy like yeast doe. but very tasty.
NO CHANGES
No i didnt like the density very much

I made this using 6tbsp of half and half and 2 TBS apple cider vinegar. I also used 1/2 C Kerry Gold butter and 6 tbsp of coconut oil in place of shortening. I'm going to chill and take out in the AM, let rest and deep fry in peanut oil. I'll let you know how they turn out but so far a 5 star recipe for me.

The dough turned out way too sticky. I tried giving it a go and rolling it out but it just made a huge mess. The reason I gave it two stars, as opposed to just one, is I was eventually able to fix it by adding a bunch more flour. I will not use this recipe again.
These were super easy to make and just as delicious. The kids and coworkers both devoured them.
Even if you don’t have a full quart of oil, these donuts still turn out wonderful! Definitely one to repeat.
Loved this recipe!! Super easy/ super tasty!

Super easy to make , I literally threw it all in a bowl and stirred , worked out well!!

They taste like vanilla donuts to me a nice compliment to my cinnamon cake donuts.

Great job! I used Splenda as we are a diabetic family
I would make it again, but it was really doughy. And i would not recommend it with icing!!!
more mike

No changes were made other than making donut holes instead of regular donuts. Made a simple glaze, a powder sugar dip and a cinnamon sugar dip as options for topping the donut holes. The children enjoyed them.

I followed the recipe and doubled it to make the servings size doubled up too. It was a soft dough, a little bit sticky, after frying, it was crunchy outside yet soft and chewy inside. I like it however, my family was so used of the soft type of donuts(like in Jco or Dunkin's) so they were kind of ok with it. :-)

Great taste, but the dough is too soft to roll. I added an additional 1/4 cup of flour, and it changed from a batter to a nice dough, easy to roll out. I made doughnuts and doughnut holes, so my yield was different. Great easy recipe!
easy and great be very careful with oil I got spat a couple of times but they were great
I will definitely make this again it is super easy and fast to make I did not fry them I baked them and they did still turn out really good other than that I made no changes

The only changes that I made was that I used apple cider vinegar and they still came out really well... My second time making them I put cake icing instead of powdered sugar on them. This is a good recipe when you want a snack or something sweet right away.
Super easy and great flavor. The kids loved them.

These were super easy and really tasty while warm. I dusted them with cinnamon sugar, instead of confectioners sugar. I want to try again when I figure out how to make coconut stick - my husband's favorite doughnut topping.
Perfect
Loved it

I must admit it was an overall easy recipe however, it was too "loose". About twice the thickness of cake batter, or really doughy. I had to add at least an extra cup of flour to thicken the batter to make dough. I don't really know if I did something wrong or what. In the end I was able to roll it out, cut it, make holes, and pick up the doughnut cutouts to fry. I also used my deep fryer not a skillet.

These were super easy and came out yummy. I followed the recipe exactly and they came out perfect. I sprinkled some cinnamon sugar combo on top while they were still warm. I used 6 T. milk with the 2 T. vinegar and let it sit a good 5 min. before adding it. I did just roll the dough in balls. Very addicting.
Made the recipe exactly as described and they were fantastic! Whole family loved it! Coated the donuts in powdered sugar and the holes in cinnamon sugar. DELISH!

This was a delicious recipe! I have made tried many donut recipes with similar ingredients but this one takes the cake! Easy and fast to make in comparison to yeast donuts. Half way through the using the dough we decided diced green apples would be yummy so we mixed them into the remaining dough. The outside was crispy and inside was fluffy. My 3 boys and invited the neighbors to come and eat them with us and their mom was in heaven-so good! The only thing I recommend is to skip donuts and make donut holes. I didn't want to add more flour to make it a consistency that I could roll out. I used a 2 Tbsp cookie scoop, and the dough expanded to double in size in the oil.
It was undercooked the outside was fried inside was still raw! I didn't read the comments, I follow the recipe, sucked! Tried to do it for international donut day!
AMAZING. So easy and tasty! ^-^

Really great recipe - I can't believe how well they came out. I made a double batch which made a dozen donuts and a few donut holes.

We made a basic glaze (not from this recipe) and then did lots of little variations. In total we did classic glaze, chocolate glaze, strawberry glaze, maple glaze, sprinkles, cinnamon & sugar, and plain sugar.

I didn't have a donut-shaped cutter, so we used a big and small heart-shaped cookie cutter. I also didn't have a mixer, so I did it all by hand. They still came out really good.
truly and simple to make and exceptional tasting

Very easy recipe and loads of fun to make with the teens. The dough itself seems a bit lacking in flavor. Next go round I'll add a pinch more salt to balance the sweetness of the heavy sugar/cinnamon I used to coat them with. They came out a tad dry/dense in the center compared with store bought. Not sure how to tweak it for a moister lighter center.

The batter/dough was sticky none rollable, I made donut holes out it, and added vanilla for flavor, oddly the donut holes turned out really well and floor was good next time I will add 1 1/2 teaspoons of vanilla instead of 1 teaspoon . Drained them put them in paper bag with mixture of sugar and cinnamon for some, the others cinnamon and Splenda for me, tasted awesome. WILL decrease milk by half as others recommended.
They taster good but the dough was too soft and I had to use a lot of flour to make it roliable.

This is a good, basic doughnut recipe, with the exception that it calls for just a tad too much liquid. I made it as written except that I used real buttermilk instead of the milk/vinegar substitute, and only put in 1/3 cup. It rolled out perfectly. (A tip that my mother taught me: when rolling out sweet things use powdered sugar instead of flour, it will add a little sweetness, but won't make your baked good tougher!) I don't have a doughnut cutter, but I used a 3" biscuit cutter and cut out the centers with one of my grandmother's cordial glasses and it worked perfectly. They fried easily. I thought they came out a little dense, but tasty. I did make a glaze of 1 C powdered sugar, 1/2 t vanilla and 2 T water to glaze the tops instead of dusting them with powdered sugar, but that's just my personal preference.

OMG, this recipe is simple and easy. I also used 1/2 cup of milk as recommended here by others. Instead of donuts, I made donut holes and just rolled the dough by hand into little balls (they will expand in the oil) and dropped them into the hot oil. They will cook fast, so watch them carefully. Others complained of sticky dough, but I just added flour a little at a time and rolled the dough until it had a firm consistency. These are simple to make and delicious to eat! My kind of recipe! My hubby loved them, so I will make them again in the future!

I multiplied this recipe by 4 and I don't know if that made a difference or not but I sure didn't have the problems others have mentioned. The dough consistency was excellent. I added vanilla and nutmeg for the old fashioned flavor. I always use lard for donuts it seems to have a better after effect and not so much grease absorption. I did do them as donuts in a donut dropper. I would definitely pass this recipe along for anybody trying donuts for the first time!
Followed recipe as stated above. Glad I didn't double it.... it makes a large batch! Don't make them too think or they will brown too quickly and the inside will be raw. Good simple recipe

Just as I was making this, I discovered that my vanilla extract had gone bad. I substituted an equal amount of maple syrup after researching possible substitutions online. I also used buttermilk. The dough was very tender and puffed up beautifully while frying. The actual flavor of the donuts though was bland. I plan on using this recipe again and will follow suggestions on making the dough more flavorful. I love how simple and easy these were to make.

I also used 1/2 cup of milk. I had a lot of problems keeping the dough together it was so sticky that it was hard keeping them in donut shapes . In the end I used a scraper for the last few ans they were almost round. All in all it was fun and I loved the donuts with a cup of BABY,S Killer Joe coffee.
My students made these for our after school program and loved them.
OIl Your Hands!!!! ball dough then poke finger in middle to make the donut shape, before putting into the hot pan. This recipe is super sticky, but super tasty and a nice crunch with soft inside.

These were a big hit with the family. I used apple cider vinegar and substituted coconut oil for the shortening, turned out really good. Really simple to make and you can have fun with fillings and icing. I put cheddar cheese curds in some of the donut holes, amazing.

as someone who has a job making mini donuts, i thought this recipe was pretty good. They don't taste the same, but they are quite similar. 
I didn't have any eggs or really much to substitute so i ended up using some miracle whip and water, which still gave it the right consistency and all.
My younger brother loves them and we tossed them in cinnamon sugar.
Would make again, but my house is very very foggy/smoky/i don't even know from the oil.
I did not like this recipe one bit. I don't know if I did something wrong or if the recipe just isn't my type, but it did not turn out good and the dough just fell apart when I went to fry.

I didn't have enough all-purpose flour on hand but was eager to whip something up. So I am reviewing based on my modification of using 50% all-purpose and 50% white whole wheat flour. While I was preparing to sour the milk I figured "what the heck" and grabbed whole milk farm fresh Kefir I,had on hand instead figuring it's cultured milk and the same concept. I used a scant 1/2 cup and added extra flour on the board before turning out the dough. After frying I coated them in cinnamon-sugar. The family loved them. Great recipe for deciding on a whim to make doughnuts before the sun set on doughnut day. Thank you.
Far too sticky to roll. The balls fell apart.
my dough was sooo sticky. im gonna try what the reviews recommend

The dough was too sticky. Then I did it again adjusting the milk to 1/2 cup still awful as the other reviews recommended. I couldn't work with the dough. Stuck to everything added more flour to make it manageable, and it after frying they were like little dense hockey doughnuts.
Very easy and quick! Tasted great and made my two year old very happy! Did the 1/2 cup of milk and Just dusted with powder sugar! note to self: turn dial to 6 for the right temp on stove
Not quite like doughnuts but still very good and very sweet! I will make it again.
This turned into a huge mess and the instructions to " roll out" was difficult. If I made them again I would squeezed them out of one of those pastry things.....

These turned out awesome! We made a few changes. We are a gluten free family, so we substituted gluten free all purpose flour, maple syrup for white sugar, and butter instead of shortening. The butter and maple syrup was amazing together!

Giving this recipe 3 stars because the taste was definitely on point... However the ingredients were way off! I had to add additional flour and I also used powdered buttermilk, in addition to the vinegar/ milk buttermilk, the dough was still not roll-able... I would say this recipe needs nearly four cups of flour or three cups of flour 1 cup of powdered buttermilk for it to be anywhere near rollable! I did not add that much additional flour , and just ended up putting the dough in my oil by dropping it in my clumps! They are ugly as sin but taste very yummy! Basically taste like state fair style funnel cake when dusted with powdered sugar!

I just made these and the dough was very sticky! I put flour down to roll them and by the time I was done I had added almost an extra half cup of flour and the dough was still sticky, tasted like flour and did not hold their shape. I think if I took the time to do adjustments these could be a good base donut but I do not forsee me taking that time with this recipe.

Great and easy receipt to make!!! I didn't adjust the milk measurements at all since the posts regarding to much milk was old and I had seen that it has been adjusted on the recipe. I did however double up on the vanilla and added in some cinnamon. Once the donuts were done I topped them with some cinnamon and white sugar... My kids loved them!!!!!
It was nice and easy to do. It was my first time making doughnuts too.

If your dough turns out too sticky using 3/8 cup of milk, then you probably did not let the vinegar and milk sit together long enough to become thick. This is a very important step! My family did not like this recipe because there was little flavor, even with the powdered sugar topping. Also, be sure you sift the flour or use bread flour. I think mine turned out a bit heavy because I wasn't careful of this.

I haven't finished them yet but I can say, following the recipe exactly, I got a batter and not a dough. I added a half cup more flour and it's still very wet. I have stuck the bowl in the 'fridge in hopes it will stiffen up enough where I will only have to add a little more flour. I'm not sure what will happen with the rise if I have to add significantly more flour. I wish I had read reviews first and discovered that this is far too much milk for this recipe. :/
These turned out awesome! Follow the instructions and it will will work out! Yummy!
The flavor was good but the dough was too loose so I had to add more flour. I would make again now knowing to decrease liquid or increase flour.

Oh my gosh! I followed the recipe exactly as it was written (as of 9/2015) and they came out great! The dough was soft and sticky but held together enough to be patted to 1/3", cut and fried. The recipe was easy to follow and came together fast. The donuts were better than I expected: warm, crispy outside, light and cooked, sweet but thankfully not too sweet. I will definitely be making these again!
I made no changes so dense and would not cook through
Followed recipe with 1/2 cup milk recommendations & watched the video. Dough was SO STICKY, had to add so much flour which resulted in heavy donuts with little flavor. I will not make these again.

Just got done.. read reviews and recipe update first..

says 10,it made 14 "holes" that's it.. this is a very small batch.. the dough is about the size of a baseball..

next time,I'll be at least tripling the ingredients.

Easy & yummy recipe! I read through lots of reviews first. Decided to stick with the 3/8C milk (which is 6Tbsp) & the 2C flour which was perfect. The only thing I changed (again, based on reviews) was I put the temp at 350 and doubled the vanilla (1Tbsp) and added approx 1tsp of Oriental Five Spices (Cinnamon, Anise, Ginger, Nutmeg, & Cloves) for added flavor. Of course, I used tons of confectioner's sugar. PERFECT!

I give this a 5 star I have tryed other recipes and this came out the closest to my grandmothers donuts. I did add some cinnamon , I had no problem rolling and cutting into donut holes. Tonight I am trying a double batch. We all love our donuts.
Made these donuts yesterday with my grand daughter. They were really delicious. There are only 4 left. We will make again next week. islandjoy

I tried this recipe, but instead of all that stuffing about with milk and vinegar, I just decided to use plain Greek yoghurt, which delivered the exact result I expected. I also didn't deep fry them, but just fried them like normal in a mixture of butter and oil. I'm going to now bring the few leftovers I have to university and see how my friends like them~

This recipe was awesome! Super crispy on the outside and cakey on the inside. I didn't really know how to calculate the 3/8ths cup thing so i just took my measuring cup and poured between the 1/2 and 1/3 cups line (too lazy for math). I also used coconut oil and instead used butter for shortening. Had to add a little more flour too for rolling it out. Looked like It wasn't going to turn out good but i was super surprised!
